content: the first or second stitch of the round knitting row until there are a total of 6 inches from the locking stitch marker brim the brim is increased in a 4 row repeat the 4th row is increased randomly to help the brim have a nice round shape don t over think this row so long as you increased between the markers it will all be ok row 1 knit row 2 knit to marker m1 repeat row 3 knit row 4 *knit to roughly the middle of the markers m1 knit to marker* repeat * repeat row 1-4 until you have 216 stitches 27 stitches between the markers for a wider brim continue increasing until you have 264 stitches 33 between the markers ***a wide brim may not be a flat after felting*** cast off felting i like to put my finished hats into a washing machine avoiding the spin cycle as this can causes creases it may take a couple of cycles to get it to fully felt i ve thrown an old pair of jeans in to help felting it by had is also totally cool too just have your elbow grease handy finishing/ tips and trick-or-treats i like to be able to bend and shape the pointy tail part of the hat the easiest way to do this is by inserting a piece of thick gauge craft wire my personal favorite is 12 gauge found at most craft stores i ve found the best way to do this is to add some plastic to the hat tail pre felting i like to use a bit of grocery bag cut into a long strip around 2ft long inserting a crochet hook from the top of the i-cord and catch the plastic you can tie the two ends together so it doesn t come out when felting after cut the plastic and slide it out you should be able to slide the wire where the plastic was if you knit the pattern as written and have now decided you want to make the tail longer fear not pick up 3 stitches from the end of the i-cord and knit a few extra inches in i-cord if it looks a little funky now it won t after its been felted after felting in the washer it can look kind of fluffy like a mohair halo a bit of hand felting can fix that or a sweater shaver or keep it the pelt look may be the kind of spooky your going for additionally giving the brim a bit of a hair cut around the edge can give it that finished look drying/ blocking the hat is easily done i like to put mine brim down on a cooling wrack for good air flow weighing down any parts of the brim as needed also shaping the tail as desired
